control

Interface IInteractiveControl

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IErrorControl, IPhotoControl
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    InteractiveControl

    public interface IInteractiveControl
extends IErrorControl, IPhotoControl
    Author:
    Conrado Uraga

    Is triggered when a user logins in the cmdview and thus updates it to allows the user to interactive with his own albums. The admin control will create an object of this and leave the rest of the responsibility to this until the user is done.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        void run(java.lang.String userid)
        Runs the photo model of the userid. Will do the communication between the model and the view passed in the parameters.
        Parameters:
        userid - user's album we wish to run.

      • setInteractiveModel

        void setInteractiveModel(IPhotoModel model)
        This links the controller to the model including any listeners requiring registration for a single user only.
        Parameters:
        model - sets the model passed in the class that implements this interface.

      • createAlbum

        void createAlbum(java.lang.String name)
        creates the album that is in the parameter. if the album already exists, we pass an error to IErrorControl.java. If not, we add it to the user's list.
        Parameters:
        name - will be the name of the album to be added in the user's list as long as it doesn't conflict with an exiting name

      • deleteAlbum

        void deleteAlbum(java.lang.String id)
        deletes the album in the user's list. Not controller already knows the user id.
        Parameters:
        id - is the photo unique identification that is linked to his list. If, for some reason, he/she passes an id that doesn't exist, we should print an error stating the user doesn't exist

      • listAlbums

        void listAlbums()
        lists the albums in the user's list

      • listPhotos

        void listPhotos(java.lang.String albumId)
        list the photos in the user's album given its ID
        Parameters:
        albumId - is the name of the album and will print the pictures(if any) information

      • addPhoto

        void addPhoto(java.lang.String albumId,
            java.lang.String photoFileName,
            java.lang.String photoCaption)
        adds the photo given the album id, the photo file name, and the caption the user wishes to add
        Parameters:
        albumId - is what the user wishes to add the photo to. If the album doesn't exist, print an error
        photoFileName - the name of the photo. If it already exists, print an error.
        photoCaption - the caption the user wishes to add to the photo.

      • movePhoto

        void movePhoto(java.lang.String albumIdSrc,
             java.lang.String albumIdDest,
             java.lang.String photoId)
        moves an existing photo to another one.
        Parameters:
        albumIdSrc - the source where the photo currently lives. If the user inputs an invalid name of the source, we print an error
        albumIdDest - the destination we wish to move the photo to. If the user passes an invalid name of the destination, we print an error
        photoId - the add of the photo we will be moving. If the user passes an id that doesn't match the id in the source album.

      • removePhoto

        void removePhoto(java.lang.String albumId,
               java.lang.String photoId)
        removes the photo in user's album
        Parameters:
        albumId - is the album the user wishes to remove the photo from. If the user inputs an invalid album id, we print an error
        photoId - is the photo id we wish to remove. If the user inputs an invalid photoID we print an error. If both succeed, print an message that to tell the user successfully removed that photo in that album

      • addTag

        <V> void addTag(java.lang.String photoId,
              java.lang.String tagType,
              V tagValue)
        adds a tag to a current photo
        Parameters:
        photoId - the id the user wishes to tag. If the id doesn't exist, we print an error
        tagType - the tag type the user wishes to add. If the tag type doesn't exist, another error to be printed
        tagValue - the value that will be attached to the photo prints a successful message once we successfully tagged the photo

      • deleteTag

        void deleteTag(java.lang.String photoId,
             java.lang.String tagType)
        deletes the tag in the photo
        Parameters:
        photoId - is the photo id we wish to delete the tag off of. If it doesn't exist, error
        tagType - is the tagtype we wish to delete. If it doesn't exist for that said photo, error.

      • getPhotoInfo

        void getPhotoInfo(java.lang.String photoId)
        prints the photo information which includes, the file name, album, date, caption, and tags
        Parameters:
        photoId - the photo id we wish to print. If it doesn't exist, ask IEC to print error

      • getPhotosByDate

        void getPhotosByDate(java.util.Date start,
                   java.util.Date end)
        retrieves all photo from the specify start and end date
        Parameters:
        start - user much specify a valid date, if user passes anything else like a string, error
        end - user much specify a valid date for the end, if user passes anything else like a string, error end paramater should not be before the start date.

      • getPhotosByTag

        void getPhotosByTag(java.lang.String tagType)
        retrieves all photos by the tag in chronological order. Tags can be specified with or without their types
        Parameters:
        tagType - the tag the user which to specify. If not, tagtype can be empty

      • logout

        void logout()
        No output for this method. Logs out the user.
